alert.note: Alert for Washington (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 11 at 12:46PM EDT until July 12 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Vermont... Winooski River At Waterbury affecting Washington County. For the Winooski River...including Waterbury...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Winooski River at Waterbury. * WHEN...Until tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...Water will continue to flood parking lots at the Waterbury State Office complex, and Rowe Field in Waterbury. Downstream in Richmond, Bridge Street at the Winooski bridge near the Round Church will continue be inundated, and the Richmond public park will remain flooded. These impacts will continue until the river level falls below 420 feet, where thereafter mainly field flooding will continue until the level drops below 417 feet. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:30 PM EDT Tuesday the stage was 425.5 feet. - Bankfull stage is 419.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 12:30 PM EDT Tuesday was 426.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon and continue falling to 416.9 feet Friday morning. - Flood stage is 419.0 feet. - Flood History...The observed maximum river stage of 426.2 feet is the 2nd highest crest in history. The highest crest in history was observed during Tropical Storm Irene where the stage reached 430 feet on 8/29/2011. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 215 AM EDT.
